title: Predicting Music Track Popularity by Convolutional Neural Networks on Spotify Features and Spectrogram of Audio Waveform
author: Navid Falah (Amirkabir University of Technology), Behnam Yousefimehr (Amirkabir University of Technology), Mehdi Ghatee (Amirkabir University of Technology), ...
relevance_why: This paper provides a novel approach to predicting music popularity using Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) on audio features and spectrograms, which can inform Haohe Liu's research on audio generation and enhancement.
background: The study employs machine learning models to predict the popularity of songs based on audio features, including spectrogram data and metadata from Spotify, aiming to understand musical trends.
contribution: This work introduces a CNN-based approach to predict music track popularity by analyzing both audio features and user engagement metrics, achieving an impressive accuracy of 95.68%.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods often relied on simpler classification techniques or solely on metadata, lacking a comprehensive data integration strategy.
technical_comparison.novelty: This research improves prediction accuracy by combining audio spectrograms with detailed metadata, leveraging deep learning for nuanced pattern recognition.

key_innovation: Utilizes a dual input approach, integrating audio spectrograms and artist-related data for more precise predictions of music track popularity.
real_world_impact: This model offers potential applications for music industry stakeholders in predicting hit tracks, optimizing marketing strategies, and enhancing song production based on predicted trends.
limitations: The dataset is limited to specific artists and genres, which may restrict the general applicability of the findings to the entire music industry.

new_terms.Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs): **Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs)** are a class of deep neural networks commonly used in analyzing visual imagery, capable of automatically detecting patterns in data.
